reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a nice zombie-shooter/survival game with - contrary to most other zombieshooters - actually has swift action and therewith a tense and interesting playstyle. For instance, the zombies in this game can run, which eliminates the main reason for other zombie games to be rather static and dull. Comes with a variety of playmodes and maps for every different skill level, from rookie to tryhard.

The main problem with this game is its community; especially when playing the Versus mode, unskilled teammates are very often frowned upon. Teamwork IS essential in this game and therefore one bad or really slow player (or troll) can offset an entire match, but in my opinion, the votekick option is overused, as well as verbal raging on newcomers or people that do not play on a regular basis. Competitiveness and 'playing for fun' is unbalanced, as most Versus games you'll play are either against a premade group of 4 pros, against a group of random newcomers, a group of ragequitters OR a combination of those: the middle level for the average, mediocre player seems to have faded away and close games are almost impossible to get, unless you have 2 pro teams against each other.

Pros:
- Fun gameplay with tense action that requires full concentration
- Well thought out characters with good voice acting
- Has a good variety of game modes that keep the game interesting for a long time
- Sound effects and music add to the 'scary' or 'horror' factor of the game in a very positive way
- Has the right mixture between gore effects and unrealisticly exaggerated images that make it attractive to the gore-lovers, but not too scary for younger kids to play

Cons:
- Overly competitive community; not really the place for the individual gamer, the newcomer or the casual player (unless you play with friends, in that case its still great)
- Despite having several game modes, everything is played on a limited amount of maps (although I have to say, there's plenty of addons available to make up for this, and it will still manage to keep your interest for quite a long time)
- When playing on Single Player, the AI have a lot of bugs that can result in unnecessary deaths (like getting stuck in a certain routine or prioritising the saviour of another AI that is incapacitated MILES AWAY) which can get REALLY frustrating if it happens in repetition.

Overall its a good game and I'd most certainly recommend it to those who like to play casually with their friends, or competitive on a high level.
Rating: 7.5/10

reviewText:
This updated review is directed to those considering buying this game at the time of a sale.

If you have not checked my profile, you will see that I have more than 4,800 hours at the time of this review.  There is a good reason for that, I can tell you this game is fun for anyone who wants to shoot zombies/infected.  Unlike other zombie games, You get to actually play as the infected against player-controlled survivors and vice versa.  It is even more fun when playing with friends in against an equally-skilled opposing team.

This game features and abundance of assorted games modes and mutations (which are sames modes but with varied tweaks) perfect for just about anyone.  If you are new, go to forums and find some new players such as yourself and add them as your friend.  Play with those friends in the campaign mode to learn the game and its infected.  Practice playing as the infected in Versus Survival mutation mode.

BEWARE,  IF YOU JUMP straight into Versus/Scavenge competitive modes before actually earning experience in a lot of campaign games, you will be met with a somewhat unwelcoming community that will vote kick you.  As with any game, you have to learn the basics before trying to go into the competitive (Versus/Scavenge) modes.  There is a good reason for this (despite the community having a bad reptuation), a infected team will exploit any weakness the other team has: be it a new player with inexperience, a slow-progressing person, or player with incomplete understanding about the game mechanics.  It is the fact that player infected can think tactically and combine their attacks whereas bot-controlled infected in campaign will go attack one-by-one but not all the time.

As a new player, the vote kicking feature will seem like your worst enemy and will even turn you off and disregard this game (A lot of silly forum threads because of these reasons).  But after awhile, you will learn that this feature is necessary as it removes AFKs, Griefers (Teamkillers/glitchers), and inexperienced players (sadly).  Remember that there is no rank system in place and therefore you will be placed with veteran players easily in Versus.  Getting dominated quickly is no fun nor is it fun for your teammates.  Strangers in versus will rant on you for single mistake (which is wrong) but one mistake on infected can mean 400 easy points to the opposing survivor team.  Likewise one mistake can mean your entire survivor team falls and unable to aquire points. In campaign you can retry to complete the map but in Versus YOU DON'T.

It would be great if you brought over experience from the xbox version of this game. BUT!! keep in mind, the standards of playing ARE MUCH higher here than on xbox.  I played xbox for the longest time before coming to pc, and I noticed one thing.  Survivors can aim a lot better than their xbox equilivents. So in xbox, the infected have the upper hand and are able to do damage even if attacking alone.  But in this PC version, attacking alone as infected will get you killed easily (you will be lucky to get close to a group bunched together).  Xbox only tranfers over: map layouts, item usage, and gameplay mechanics.

Unlike Resident Evil games, you will have to work with your teammates to succeed here.  Remember this is a co-operative game, you are playing as normal survivor and NOT some superhuman charater like in Resident Evil or Dead Rising games.  You cannot LONE WOLF it in Competitive modes, (theres a mutation game mode for those kinds of players)

As time passed, the game introduced the Workshop. This allows you to customized your game to whatever you want.  Add some mods, character skins, custom music, visuals, whatever. It changes the look of the game to what you want but only you will see it though.  Example: you can change the survivors to anime characters or change the infected look, etc.

Finally, remember this game requires communication so I suggest you get a HEADSET or microphone but it is not really neccessary.  Play with friends and take time to learn the game.  Remember your version of ''Fun'' may not be the same as the your teammates so you can't just play the competitive modes and expect your team accept your shortcomings unless they are on your friends list.

IGN Quote : Ultimately
date: enjoyment derived from this game depends on you are playing with and how you are playing."....."this is very social minded game that really plays of human nature...""

reviewText:
If you're looking for a 1 sentence review, Even if this game was $100 or even $150 I would buy it, totally worth it.

Without a doubt, the ABSOLUTE BEST coop (& zombie based) game I have ever played, & probably ever will play (probably until L4D3).
I compare ALL other coop games to this game.
I just keep coming back to L4D2 no matter what, even after years, I just love this game so much! Can't get enough of it.  I can't remember even a second where I wasn't bored with L4D2. This game is like my salvation, always there for me whenever I get bored, always ready to be awesome & fun.

And you know the best part? Even if there was only the 5 basic maps, I would still play this game for years on end, it's just that much FUN.  (the game comes with more than 5 campaigns; 5 L4D2 original campaigns, 5 L4D campaigns, 2 cross-over campaigns & 1 Community campaign that was made Official due to it being super awesome)
This game in phenominal in the way that you don't mind playing the same campaigns over & over again, every time it's a different experience.  And then of course there's the campaigns in the Workshop, that add so much more to the game & show cool new features too!

If you want a game where you can play with friends, shoot zombies, have sht tons of fun, & with a little bit of tactics & smart play mixed in, this is the game you've been waiting for!

reviewText:
Interested in Zombie killing?  Looking to survive the apocalypse?  This first person shooter game maybe the key to all mankind.

The great thing about this game is the versatility as well as the variety of zombie attacks.  You can go from story line by yourself to with your friends or even with strangers.  There are various levels such as easy, normal, advanced and campaign.  But that's not all.  There are more game modes that will keep you interested!

Fight in multiplayer cooperative games such as survival to see how long you can last.  Best part about it, you never win... you always die!  Go more into depth with the game and become infected with your teammates and attack the other teams in versus or savenge.

What did you say? The game is too easy?  Try it out in realism.  This game mode does not give you help like glowing ammo or items.  They don't even tell you where your friends are.  Like in real life, you have to find where they are for yourself!

With Mutations, you have a set of rules or variations of the game you play by... so if you are looking for a harder version of survival... Nightmare may be your answer... Want to shoot all zombies with a M60? No problem! Gibs fest will grant that.

All these are fun and dandy, but the game wouldn't be the game that it is without 3rd party server hosts, dedicated and casual players as well as contributors to the steamworkshop where you can add more maps, skins and textures to your game by subscribing to the item so you have the newest updates for those items as well!. :)

We long for a LFD3, but as the game continuously grow with players and mods from the workshop things can get quite... Interesting.

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a game where four survivors attempt to survive and escape the zombie horde.
If they survive or not, is up to you, and how you play.

Left 4 Dead 2 manages to be fast-paced in a genre of slow zombie survivals, but it also still manages to retain the tense and stressful nature of the rest of the zombie games. There is no aim down sights in the game, unless you are using a sniper rifle, similar to the rest of Valve's games. Another thing in line with the rest of Valve's work is the lack of regenerating health. In Left 4 Dead 2, players must use first aid kits in order to heal themselves, with adrenaline shots and painkillers acting as 'temporary' health. Much of your survival depends on how well you utilize your first-aid...

Do you save it in case something goes wrong, do you use it on someone else, or do you use it like it's the last chance you'll ever get...? Will you ever find more down the road?

These are the questions you'll quickly ask yourself and the rest of your party as you try to make it through.

Other than the healing items, there are various other items to keep an eye out for as well. Pipe bombs, molotovs, and even a jar of bile. Pipe bombs draw standard zombies to them with a loud beeping sound and a bright red light. In Left 4 Dead, loud sounds will attract zombies, and the pipe bomb in particular will keep them away from you, and will eventually kill them when it explodes. The molotov is a simple but effective weapon in keeping the horde away, it puts down a field of fire and it burns enemies. The last item is the bile jar. It attracts the horde to anything you throw it at, and they'll stay on it for a while, killing whatever it happens to land on. Even other zombies.

The jar is filled with the insides of a boomer, one of the special infected of the game.
The special infected of Left 4 Dead 2 are zombies with unique abilities that will prove deadly to survivors, and will require cooperation or a skilled shot to take down. Perhaps both..

The Boomer is a large zombie that vomits on survivors. This attracts the horde of generic zombies to attack them. However, if the survivors are not careful in dispatching the boomer, it will explode on death and splatter on the survivors, turning a situation from bad to worse.

The Hunter is a fast and agile zombie with a normal body frame, making it slightly harder to distinguish than other special infected when running. However, when it gets into a crouching position, it pounces on survivors and claws them until they die. It can pounce from very high locations to do extra damage, or it can ambush survivors from unexpected places. The Hunter wears a hoodie, and growls when getting ready to attack, screaming loudly when pouncing.

The Smoker is a tall zombie that coughs a lot. That's why you don't smoke, because then you'll get lungs like this guy.
Anyways, the smoker has long reach, allowing it to pull survivors around, and into dangerous positions. Smokers will try to pull you into a car alarm to draw the horde to you, or they will try to pull you to another special infected so they can try to pick off another survivor, or maybe they'll just pull a survivor off a ledge, either getting them stuck holding it for their life, or forcing the victim to run all the way back to their group.

The Tank is a large, massive, and powerful zombie that can kill the entire group if left unchecked. They have huge muscles, which makes them an easy target, but it also represents their strength. One punch from a tank, and you'll fly several feet away from the rest of the survivors, and, on high difficulties, it could even end you in one hit. They can even toss rubble at the survivors, giving them a range option, as well as already being lethal in close quarters.

The Jockey is a small zombie, he runs fairly quickly and jumps on survivors, 'riding' them away into danger.

The Spitter is a taller type of special infected that spits acid onto survivors, being an effective long range unit that can deny an area to the survivors, or flush them out. Spitters also drop a pool of acid when they die, making them a bit more dangerous to deal with, especially when you are being pressured by a large amount of zombies.

The Charger is a large zombie that literally charges survivors. They run at the survivors with full speed and once they pick up a target, they continue running for a while, or until they hit something. This makes them very dangerous in situations where they can thrust you off of a dangerous height, or if there's deep water, because they can sacrifice themselves and take you with them.

Now, we've covered all of the special infected, and there's also uncommon infected as well, but I won't go over them here in order to save some space, and they aren't too important anyways.

The gunplay in Left 4 Dead 2 is very easy to get used to. From assault rifles, shotguns, pistols, melee weapons, snipers, and even grenade launchers, players should find it simple to point and shoot at zombies. Headshots are obviously more rewarding, as it will kill them zombie faster, and you'll save some ammo too. There are different deployable ammo types as well, which have different properties. High explosive, for example, will explode!

In Left 4 Dead 2, there are events in the game where you have to do something very loud in order to progress, but they draw a LOT of attention. These are called 'Crescendo Events'. These actions cause a massive attack from the infected, and require the survivors to defend themselves until the action is completed. Some events are gauntlet styled, which require survivors to run, rather than wait. Zombies will keep spawning in these gauntlet styled events, so it's best to move quickly. Also, at the jukebox, there's a song that plays and it says 'All we wanna do is eat your brains', which will also spawn enemies.

When a survivor dies, you can rescue them in closets through the game, or revive them with a defibrillator. However, you can rescue them before that and revive them when they are down. Going down too often without using first aid will result in death, which can be noted when the screen turns grey. Some game modes disable spawning, so it may be suited for super serious players.

At the end of every campaign, there is a final chapter, a finale.
In the end, survivors hold out until rescue arrives, and this is the last stand for the campaign.
Whoever dies here, is dead at the end, and at least one survivor must escape.
Being prepared is extremely important here, as it will require determination from all survivors.
Occasionally, the finale will also require the survivors run through another 'gauntlet' styled attack, except the finales are far more dangerous than the standard events, featuring more enemies and lots of special infected.

I recommend getting the game for CO-OP, it's great at what it does, which is being a great CO-OP experience.
For the single players, I honestly have trouble with recommending this game because there simply isn't enough to justify getting it just to play with the AI. The AI is extremely dumb, and they have HORRIBLE reaction times, occasionally letting you take massive amounts of damage before they save you, and not bothering to shoot the special infected, but instead they try to melee them when they are on you, making them waste valuable seconds needed to save your life. There's also not really a real 'story', other than backstories about the survivors and backstories about the other stuff around you. While some people have grown into the characters of L4D, I personally have not cared about any one of them enough to feel connected with the game itself. The soundtrack is also not really worth mentioning, in my opinion. It has a nice attempt at trying to place a dark feeling, but it's simply average at best. Gameplay also becomes monotonous without friends and workshop content, but you'll get a lot of replayability

reviewText: This game isn't brand new anymore and as such it must be said that the graphics aren't the reason anyone should buy this game. If you're looking for a game that's amazing to look at so that you can take tacky screenshots to post on your hideous profile then this isn't the right choice. If you want a game with exciting and extremely diverse gameplay, with game modes that offer a whole plethora of experiences and cater to many different tastes then this is the game to buy. Great value for money, A real classic that will keep you entertained for a long time if you manage to discover the particular game mode that suits you best. The game is also supported by a (once) strong modding community that has created an extensive collection of mods and additional content such as maps and minigames for you to enjoy.\n\nMust be said that the community within certain sections of the game is one of the most toxic, unfriendly and devoid of skill that you will find anywhere. Don't expect a warm greeting in versus mode if you're new to the game and have little experience and skill. You will be kicked again and again; My advice is that you should play campaign until you have a solid grasp of how the game works before playing versus.

reviewText: Left 4 Dead 2 is the Fps of choice to the gore hounds and the zombies lovers. The game itsef is not much like classic zombies where survival is the top priority, instead its more of a first person shooter, where landing your shots and have sharp senses will many times decide your fate. Getting infected is not a thing as the survivors in this game cannot turn. Zombies are so weak and so fragile, they there simply to slow you down. The real game is between the survivors and the special infected, mutated zombies variants, that use they multiple habilities to kill the survivors, and as they are the only ones that can be controled by humans, its a game of teamwork where the best team wins, in a 4vs4 versus game action. Now the worse part, the commnuity, you will always seem to find yourself stuck in the same situation, in a game with 3 other people in campaign where one of them starts to shoot everyone and leave, or in a versus game where your team joins and leaves, changing faster than you can keep up, while the other team is alwasy the same 4 people, just spamming, bringing up excuses evertime ur attack is sucessfull, and scream at you full force and CAPS LOCK with no regrets every swear word in the english dictionary everytime you survive they combined attack. You will be invited to a lot of Get owned groups and You suck, your mother will get insulted a lot in every language you can possibly imagine, and your teammates leaving you faster than rats in a sinking ship, but if, and only if, you luck out and find yourself great friends, you will enjoy this game for all its worth it.\n8/10 The best zombie game to play with friends, the worst game to play alone.

reviewText: First I thought this would just be another one of those zombie games, but then I realized that there is a lot more to it. There are not just zambees but a huge variety of them like, smokers, those monkey zombies, and these chargers who run right into you and have way too much health. This game is fun and I recommend it. This has to be one of my favorite Co op games. The second reason that makes this game so special is that this game requires a lot of teamwork. If someone has low health and they don't have a med kit, you should heal them. Or when people are about to fall from a ledge help them up and when people are lying on the ground, you should try to revive them. The more people you have, the quicker you get the job done.\n\nThe only negatives to this game is L4D community. If you are AFK for a little bit, they kick you. Another example is that if you're trying to save yourself but this other person is being attacked and is low on health, they hate you for not helping them out. I've had an instance where a guy had to leave and then a new person replaced him. The other player in the game was being whiny and really wanted to kick him because he want the other player back. One of the biggest things that ♥♥♥♥ the hell out of me are the players in scavenge. They kick you almost all of the time if you are not helping the team. This is a few of the reasons why I hate Valve. But this rarely bothers me or anyone if you are good at this game. 8/10 And oh god is the Witch creepy!

reviewText:
It's a yes/no review.
From left 4 dead the orginial back in 2008, I loved how dark and complicated some of maps were. I loved the Sacrafice, and the orginal maps (not so much Crash Course though.)
When Left 4 dead 2 came out, I expected the same gloominess and terror in each map, but with some of the maps, I didn't feel it. I appreciate Hard Rain, which was pretty cool. But some of the maps were not scary, or just too bright with the sunlight and what not.
I liked the original dark setting, which kind of changed the way I felt about playing Left 4 dead 2.
The game is good, but number one will always be my favorite.

reviewText: There’s nothing more frustrating than having to depend on a loved one not to do something awful. In normal games you just have to believe in their skill, but Left 4 Dead 2 changes all of that with The Witch. She won’t hurt you if you don’t bother her. You could just walk past her, wave a bit, and be on your way. That is, assuming your friend isn’t a backstabbing pile of filth.\n\nYou’re playing over Steam (obviously) and chatting like old drinking buddies when your friend suddenly goes quiet. No
date: you plead with yourself as you hear the strained breathing of someone about to pull off a devious prank. Your friend's character slowly turns--it’s probably Coach--and raises his gun. The world is quiet. Then in one split second he fires at The Witch and your whole team is dead. The quiet returns, this time accompanied by your once-friend’s crazed laughter. They got you! Man what a jib. Yeah, screw you dude. I'm leaving you to die when I find the chopper.

reviewText:
Ever wondered its time to join the 'zombpocalypse'? Left 4 Dead 2 is the best place for you. Four survivors with an arsenal of weapon ranging from chainsaw to M60 and lots and lots of Infected trying to hunt you down.

L4D2 picks up where the first game left off, only with new survivors to hunt and be hunted. The short story of the game is spread through 5 chapters (although it was expanded with DLC campaigns). It is not overtly complicated and deep, but it can be suspected for a game of this nature and fairly this is not the most important part of this game. On normal settings the campaign can be completed around 4 hours or so, if you have access to the DLC campaigns it will extend the fun to 6-7 hours. Amping up the difficulty will increase the challenge and frustration originating from the retries you have to take to complete the chapters. While the story is not the richest out there, the game features some amazing voice over and writing. The characters are funny, witty and believable -- in the world of the game of course.

When you (if you at all) breeze through the campaign with bots this is when the real fun begins. Online multiplayer is its name. Simply, this game is meant to be played with other humans. First of all, the AI is not horrible, bud it is bad enough that you will be constantly ripping out your hair while playing the game SP (especially on harder difficulties) Not to mention the Infected AI is much better. Second, the shooting is at its best when you are surrounded with real humans trying to help you survive or chasing you as Infected. Yes, there are game modes (Versus, Scavange, etc.) where you can show your skills as a Spitter, Charger or any type of Special Infected.

The challenges will just never end with this game. You can play different MP modes like Versus or the newly introduced Scavange (collecting cans and filling up the generator while the Infected are trying to stop you). Or if you want you can just play the campaigns again with human help. If you are tired you can jump on community servers or try the endless number of easy-to-use mods created for the game by the community.

Here we are again. Valve have proved again that they are indeed the masters of Multiplayer Madness. After hits like Counter Strike, Team Fortress we have the upcoming wave of games like the L4D2 series and DotA 2. While the SP mode is not much engaging and falls short of expectations and you may not care about the characters in the end, if you ever want to just jump in and oppose the endless hordes of zombies while having super fun, this is the ultimate and most definite place to start.

Rating: 85/100; Replay Value: 5/5; To Beat: 6 hours (SP - with the campaign DLCs); Played on: normal.

reviewText: Damn it, no, I can't. Even if I would want, I can't recommend L4D2 over L4D1. I'm gonna skip the community thing as often players are behaving like bunch of idiots even outside of game (vide forums etc.) so I think it doesn't worth any commentary as it won't save this game.\nDespite having more hours played in sequel, when I bought L4D1 I felt like I'm playing completely different game. In my opinion it's the L4D1 which looks like finished product, more polished, way less glitched and annoying with its gameplay mechanics. Everytime I turn on L4D2 I see idiotic Survivors animations, ugly flying pistols and unbellevable amount of melee weapons and SMGs, like game wanting to say „C'mon, don't pretend to be a hero, just take that axe and run like idiot – I'm gonna kill you anyway during next Crescendo Event if you won't drop your pistols”. I don't say L4D1 is easier – maybe sometimes it is, but I feel that thinking ain't necessary (and even welcome) in L4D2.\nSomeone may say that I'm another L4D1 addict being mad at Valve because of L4D2 and porting older campaigns, but no, I can't be like that since I actually bought L4D1 after buying L4D2 (yes, I was that dumb) and while I feel L4D1 was worth my money, I think I wasted $$$ on L4D2. But I am mad at Valve as I think L4D2 is step back. And the saddest thing is that people moved anyway to then new and fresh game which is now practically as old as L4D1 which I prefer.

reviewText: Left 4 dead 2 is one of the most interactive co-op game I've ever played. This game will appeal to others who are looking for competitive, fun, and intense gameplay. Feel the wrath of hundred and hundred of zombies launching themselves at your throats.\n\nDon't stop for one sec for a Smoker to bind you with it's tongue. Don't stay in a open spot for a Hunter to claw you to death. Don't seperate from your teammates, you'll find yourself at the mercy of an Jockey. Zombies aren't your only enemies, watch your feet for acid that burns like no others from the mouth of an Spitter. Zombies are not noticing you? Then bathe in the bile of a Boomer to show a horde of zombies how good you looked......to eat. Narrow areas are the Charger's favorite spot to squash you into pancakes. She may be crying, but once the Witch is startled, you're in for a world of hurt, hope you have health insurance. Rarely appears, the Tank is the boss of zombies. He's one badass that will put your lights out.

reviewText:
My review for Left 4 Dead 2

- I can say that this game, is one of the famous pioneer of zombie co-op game. While this is the sequel, but this game complete its predecessor.

- Really fun to play with friends.

- Can be modded. Definitely good feature here.

- The enemies not really that frightening because first, the way they behave are funny, second, you got 3 more friends (or AI) have your back. Be careful though, don't let them swarm your team.

- Not only normal zombies, but also unique special zombies with different abilities, and also uncommon normal zombies that have unique traits on them.

- Different game mode to play. There's versus mode who can make you the special zombies, and have purpose to prevent the survivor from saving themselves. There's also more game mode like scavenger, survival, realism. You can even add more with mods.

- A lot of choices of weapons. Additional melee weapons that makes this game better than its predecessor.

8.7/10

Awesome coop/PvP game with zombies, i really enjoying this game.

+Graphic (It's not a newbie or something special but it's not horrible)
+Gameplay
+Such of a game modes(Scavenge,Survival,Versus etc)

-This is maybe the biggest problem of the game > community...you're playing with normal players, you got teamwork, teammates what are helping to others etc., but there're too little russian kids what are all the time screaming to the microphone, totally don't know how to play game, they don't play with team and they're attacking teammates.


So, if would i recommend this game? Definetly yes, great content, a lot of campaigns, i didn't mention the fact that you can still download more campaigns from the workshop. Decent selection of weapons, lot of game modes to play and more. Make a squad of friends to play to avoid annoying children. The price is 13.99 but don't give up and buy it, JUST-DO-IT!!! DON'T LET YOUR DREAMS BE DREAMS!

reviewText: OK, so I was gifted this game after being on the fence for many years about purchasing it, and I'm kicking myself... for not getting it sooner. It is a good single player effort but the multiplayer is almost perfect. The worst thing about this game is the community. But don't let that discourage you. I was lucky enough to find a group of guys and gals who play games for the fun and friendship and don't really care if you aren't a perfect player. The public matches are not so nice but stick with them. I have found that if you just make sure you are a team player and watch each others back or attack together that you will most likely survive a public match. You may not win, but you won't get booted either.\n\n
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is one of those classic must own games on steam.

The game premise revolves around being able to choose between four characters - and a certain gun set such as machine guns and shotguns. Multiple zombie hoards come attacking you wave after wave and can stop suddenly. Which sets this game apart from other zombie games is there is certain zombie types in this game. One guy as a tongue that stretches out and grabs people, another guy is a big fat blob who goes around puking on people and attracting zombies to them (and when he dies he blows up)! The game is set up as FPS with the player having the ability to heal themselves (while being not able to shoot) or heal their partner. The best game setting for me personally was the ability to play humans vs zombies where you take charge of one of the special zombie types.

This game was close to getting a rating around 7.7 (as the premise for me can get boring after sometime), but it being the original hard hitting zombie title I will give it an 8.

8/10

I was lucky enough to find a group of guys and gals who play games for the fun and friendship and don't really care if you aren't a perfect player. The public matches are not so nice but stick with them. I have found that if you just make sure you are a team player and watch each others back or attack together that you will most likely survive a public match. You may not win, but you won't get booted either.\n\n

reviewText:
What I really liked about the game was how easy it was to become adjusted to the game as a beginner.

Of course, it is most recommended to play as single player or with friends when getting started.
As I went through the game, it was neat picking on tips and tricks either learned by other players or things that worked best for me later on.

Special infected are as interesting as irritating, but it is all a part of the game and why it makes things fun.

The characters and plot are great. Everyone seems to have their favorite when playing  these campaigns.
Some love and some hate these certain characters.

On the other hand, playing online is a completely different story. Some games go smoothly with little to no issues, while other times a single player can take down their own team or slow them down.

A con would have to be lagging depending on the internet/server.

Another con is that third party servers are irritating when going after achievements. If you're going for achievements, stay way from third party servers they make it harder depending on the group.

It is always important to keep in mind what your skill level as well as everyone else. Join a game/create a game that is best suited for you, joining a game that is out of your league or too easy may hinder your group.

Overall, the game is essentially about teamwork and how others bring out each other's strengths as well as weaknesses.
It's a gamble everytime creating a lobby or joining someone's team to see if everyone will carry through to the end.

I highly recommend it, and I hope that this game is just as much fun for others as it has been for me.
I apologize for any grammar errors, and thank you for taking the time to read it.

reviewText:
A timeless co-op experience; full of varying types of zombies, weapons and  characters. This game is made by valve so performance issues are practically non-existant, apart from the occasional crash, the optimisation is great.
The introduction of the workshop  allows you to play community made maps along with with modifications to the base game, for example: you could turn a gnome into killer keemstar,  KILLER ♥♥♥♥ING KEEMSTAR  or maybe you want to turn your tank into shrek, the sky is the limit. With varying amounts of game modes too, this game has plenty of bang for your buck regardless of if it is on sale or not.
If you haven't already got this game, do yourself a favour and click that purchase button.

reviewText:
Gameplay controls are easy to learn and master. Modding the game, downloading new maps, skins, or different game modes is very easy due to Steam Community Workshop. If some aspect of the game becomes dull and unintriguing, you can always find new content on the Steam Workshop.

It's fun at first, but over time it starts lacking the same experience as in the beginning if you keep paying the same game modes.  The community isn't the greatest either when it comes to newer players. You automatically receive a nasty comment when you make a mistake. Game would be more fun if other players weren't as discouraging. But, not all players are bad and rude, there are some players that help you out and teach you other things that you might've not already known.

I'm putting this review as recommended but my thoughts about this game are mixed and I'd recommend on some aspects but not on other ones. The biggest downside to this game, I think, is the childish Community, but if you're up for it and don't really care about that, it would be a fun game. On the otherhand, if you dislike childish Communities, don't buy this game unless you're going to play with close friends that don't mind you sucking at first or completely carrying the team depending how good you are.

reviewText:
This game promotes highly on teamplays, assisting others as well as communicating with your fellow teammates.

There are 2 roles that you can play in this game:

* As a human survivor *

You will spend just as much time protecting, helping and healing your teammates as the difficulty progresses. Everything from sharing resources to pulling them up off of a ledge. Leaving a teammate behind decreases your chances of survival and running off on your own almost always ends tragically. Hence, you will come to realise that it is fun sticking together and helping one another.

**As a special infected (e.g. Smoker, Boomer, Charger, Jockey, Tank, etc...) [Only in versus mode] **

Similar plays are executed from a different perspective. Only when the team that plans and works together as a whole will prevent the survivors from progressing the stage and winning. Attacking alone rarely has much of an effect since you'll get focused as soon as you are spotted, but there are a few opportunities  that allows zombie heroics (like the coveted death charge).

This game offers many competitive modes with different difficulty levels of your choice. It also brings teamplay to a whole new level as you challenge higher difficulty as you progress.

Worth a shot if you like zombie games! Recommended.

reviewText:
Atrocious community. Ive met several pretty cool people, but Ive also met hundreds of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

The versus mode is the most popular online mode, and its fun, when you can get a balanced game going. This is almost impossible to accomplish, however. Im not sure how many versus games Ive played... maybe 100? Out of those, 2... TWO have been balanced games. Both those times my team lost point wise, but we all won because everyone had lots of fun. The remaining 98 have been total routes for one side the entire match. Even on the winning side, its just not very fun.

Also, happen to not play with absolute perfection? You get vote kicked, despite you probably doing better than the other 3 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s your with.

Happen TO play with absolute perfection, at least relative to your teammates? You get vote kicked anyway, because the 3 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s want ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ #4 to join their game and your holding up the spot.

From what I gather the community has deteriorated over time. I wish I had gotten this when it was new. Unfortunately I didnt even know it had come out.

Gameplay wise, the game could use some tweaking. There are several blatantly unbalanced quirks" this game has
date: that detract from an otherwise balanced experienced. But overall its well done and fun to play.\n\nThe game alone is enjoyably designed for the most part. Unfortunately this being a co-op centered game
recommended: the community brings down the games final rating by several notchs
hoursPlayed: since the community is integral to this games experience.\n\nPossibly recommended when on sale just to give it a try."

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead perfected the co-op shooter, this expanded on it. The idea of team based-cooperation is thoroughly explored through realism modes that remove crucial aids such as outlines through walls, melee adds depth to the concept of corner camping, and anti-camping enemies make every area a peril.
Twice as big as Left 4 Dead, even more when you bring in custom campaigns, the game ensures that the core concepts are given more than their fair share of replayability.

Recommended custom campaigns from the Valve-run Left 4 Dead blog, for your convenience!

reviewText: Left 4 Dead 2 is about a group of people trying to escape a zombie apocalypse who meet on the top of a tower. You can do the missions more than once or in different orders, but there is an actual story line, which I find interesting. There are more guns and more options in L4D2 than L4D, even most of the maps from L4D are playable in L4D2. The grapics are great and it runs nicely on my computer. It's a highly addictive game and it'll be hard to put it down. Highly recommended.

reviewText: This game is a guaranteed good time.  The controls are intuitive and the environment is so fluid.  You never walk into an invisible polygon like in some games.  The characters are developed through little snippets of dialogue throughout the game, but you're not hit over the head with any cutscenes or too much story.  All the maps with the exception of Cold Stream are highly replayable and well done.  There is also so much third party content that you can download, due to the great engine that runs the game.  Recomend you play online with friends.  Versus with random people can get ugly.

reviewText: This game is an emotional roller coaster that pits your mind against that of societal pressures and influences to the breaking point. The only thing that you have left is your sanity, when everyone else is losing theirs, and you must act as one of four lost souls in a quest to--Oh who am I kidding, this is a zombie game. This game is great fun with other due to derpy AI, smooth PC gameplay, well optimized engine that runs well on lower end PC's, and large selection of levels and difficulties plus competitive multiplayer.\n\nI recommend this game, along with the first because of the new increased map repertoire.

reviewText: Well, it offers a wider selection of guns, larger, better lit maps, all the maps of L4D1, and melee weapons. Weapons have been balanced demoting the shotgun as the weapon of choice. All in all, it should be better than L4D, but it isn't. It lacks the character of L4D1, and is more hectic, which sounds great, but it makes it a less sociable game - there simply isn't time to be sociable in this L4D2: Stop to chat and you die! It's still one of the best games ever produced though, but not quite as good as L4D1.

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 will always be a classic game to play, especially being a sequel to a game that was too, amazing. The introductions from the first game, such as new Special Infected, new weapons and campaigns makes this game a must buy to any gamer. The campaign has the standard maps, which in turn are great, but best played with friends, as the AI are dull in the sense to play with, as they will basically do most of the shooting for you. The Multiplayer aspect to the game, such as Versus will always have people playing and there are plently of servers to play with. A warning though, Versus does get extremly competitive at times and you will want to die inside if you are losing.

Pros:
- Improved from the original Left 4 Dead
- Extremly balanced gameplay
- Great level design
- Guns and Special Infected improved
- Fun for everyone. Single player is fun, Campaign with friends is fun and Multiplayer is fun.

Cons:
- If you don't have friends then the game can be boring.
- AI on singleplayer will do everything for you. (Can be seen as a good thing, but not entirely)
- Hard Rain will make you want to cry and die inside. (Like the witches)
- Left 4 Dead was known for being dark and more tense with gameplay, which is completly lacking in Left 4 Dead 2. Only in a few areas is there darkness, but instead you walk down streets completly bright. Only in a minority of maps, such as the swamp maps and when it rains is there any kind of fear.

Overall, the game is a must buy for everyone. Now that is has been a few years, I do suggest only getting it when it is on sale. Playing the game just for the campaign will get you a few hours played, but if you do get into the versus and the competitive game modes, you will be guarenteed a ton of hours played.

reviewText:
Rank:	7.5/10
Recommendation(s):	Play Left 4 Dead 1 first.
Major Theme:	Your zombie action movie that you get to be a part of.
Bought at Price:	Valve Complete Pack

Valve and multiplayer games. Well, they go together very well. Not sure what really else you want to know.

The game mechanics work great, the game has workshop support; it is also well taken care of by Valve and the community.

If you have a chance, listen to the developer commentary. It will give you a real look inside the games Valve makes.

Most people who have things bad to say about the game say things like:
This stuff should have been in Left 4 Dead 1.
There's limited maps.
Why isn't there this ridiculous zombie type X, Y, Z
Answering those problems… Yes, I'm aware of the controversy around the splitting of games. I know I wouldn't have liked it, but I bought the complete pack after this happened, and long before TF2 became free2play. For me, the split seems to make logical sense. Left 4 Dead 1 was a harder game partly due to the fact of the limited weapons. Left 4 Dead 2 opened the doors on this and added a variety of things. While you can play Left 4 Dead 1 maps in the 2nd game, I still feel the need to play it on the original game, with the original mechanics.

Limited maps.. Well it does follow a story, and the maps use a AI director in the background to make changes to maps. In the core, there are about 3 or 4 (if I remember correctly) base maps for each part of a campaign that get used. The director makes changes to spawns and what not on the fly. You probably won't be playing thousands of hours on this title, but expect a good return for your money.

Zombie types… This is a big thing with some people. The root of this issue is that there aren’t any binding specs to zombies". Does the mutation/virus/disease effect people
hoursPlayed: what can happen to each?\n\nValve tries to make the game reasonable
voteText: and the mechanics show that. They are well balanced
helpfulPercent: and don’t require hundreds of hours to perfect."

reviewText:
Almost every gamer loves zombie games, L4D2 has the 2nd best story i've experienced (Behind Resident Evil 4) and very colourful characters. Multiplayer is awesome especially with friends you know personally (Or on steam) It's very simple to play so noobs can pick it up easily but takes time to master, it really gives the player that It feels good to help and work together" sensation

The good:

Decent storyline and loveable characters
Graphics are pretty good
Gameplay is easy to pick up quickly though sometimes "graphic bugged" (Actually rigged in favor of bad players)
Can be exhilerating to play with friends and help each other survive
A great game for the extroverted type of player
Never the exact same zombie and item spawn locations twice giving the player the unpredicable feeling and great for lifespan

The bad:

Trolls on multiplayer that incap you with autoshotties and molotovs when you're trying those expert achievements
Rigged in multiplayer in favor of new/bad players so they don't quit playing (Charging through players
recommended: the AI director spawing less hordes for them
hoursPlayed:
Aimbots that help them get headshots)
Bots can be absolute dumb-f*cks since it is a game that plays by the situation and not by the book (Bots ALWAYS play by the book)
Mutation mode and single player mode should be more one player friendly and much more beatable
Somehow keep ending up playing with noobs all the time or kicked for the most minute reasons
Definately not a game for loners or hermits as its heavily team-coordinated
Modded multiplayer campaigns and VS games can make it extremely unfair in favor of the player(s) hosting it

Overall I reccommend it but give it time before you play certain modes and always expect the bad so they'll be no shock or nasty surprises"

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 will always be a classic game to play, especially being a sequel to a game that was too, amazing. The introductions from the first game, such as new Special Infected, new weapons and campaigns makes this game a must buy to any gamer. The campaign has the standard maps, which in turn are great, but best played with friends, as the AI are dull in the sense to play with, as they will basically do most of the shooting for you. The Multiplayer aspect to the game, such as Versus will always have people playing and there are plently of servers to play with. A warning though, Versus does get extremly competitive at times and you will want to die inside if you are losing.

Pros:
- Improved from the original Left 4 Dead
- Extremly balanced gameplay
- Great level design
- Guns and Special Infected improved
- Fun for everyone. Single player is fun, Campaign with friends is fun and Multiplayer is fun.

Cons:
- If you don't have friends then the game can be boring.
- AI on singleplayer will do everything for you. (Can be seen as a good thing, but not entirely)
- Hard Rain will make you want to cry and die inside. (Like the witches)
- Left 4 Dead was known for being dark and more tense with gameplay, which is completly lacking in Left 4 Dead 2. Only in a few areas is there darkness, but instead you walk down streets completly bright. Only in a minority of maps, such as the swamp maps and when it rains is there any kind of fear.

Overall, the game is a must buy for everyone. Now that is has been a few years, I do suggest only getting it when it is on sale. Playing the game just for the campaign will get you a few hours played, but if you do get into the versus and the competitive game modes, you will be guarenteed a ton of hours played.

reviewText:
I feel like it's well overdue that I make a review for this game.

I bought L4D2 on the day of its release, and I immediately became invested in it. Because of L4D, I often did not play Campaign and immediately went into Versus Mode. I learned very quickly how to communicate with my team, and look for key things such as where items might spawn and what would be most useful to the team.

In this game you really have to rely on things like having some form of communication (most preferrably a microphone), and you have to keep a sharp eye out for special spawns and when your teammates are likely to get hit, or are hit.

You also have to know that this is a very competitive multiplayer game. If you don't cooperate, more than likely you're going to get kicked; it isn't a fun feeling. Another thing to add, is that you will definitely become enraged with this game and its ridiculous moments. You'll probably foam at the mouth for a while, and then you'll say how much you want to quit. But then, you'll want to come back to it for whatever god-forsaken reason. You come back for the hilarious moments, the moments where you actually push through and you win a game. That's the reason I keep going back. I don't let my losses permanently affect my views on the game. A lot of it is luck of the draw, so why bother being mad at it?

I don't really know how helpful this is in terms of the game's content, but everyone by now should know what it is. It's a zombie-based FPS that's a whole rollercoaster of fun. Try it, if you haven't already.

reviewText:
Hmmm... Why buy left for dead 2? I am 30+ year old gamer, one of the old schoolers who grew up with just about every console and pc game around.

I promise this game will satisfy both your shooting FPS needs as well as the Co-Op thing, This is the real deal. No Rambo BS here (RAMBO = one man show can kill all the zombies by him/her self), you won't survive a minute on your own (the game is made that way).

Luckily through this game I have been able to find really good Co-Op friends and that is probably the main reason that I play this game so often.

It's like a little like multiplayer chess game, everytime you play, there are different challenges ahead, allthough its exactly the same level, the same horde and so on, the players ability to Co-Op decides the outcome (Yeah!!!!)

So get this game if you like real Co-Op and FPS combined.

One tip though, to truly enjoy the games co-op feautures you have to go at it at the hardest level (Expert) and play on realism (no help in game)). On the easier settings/levels the Rambo mode is still at works, meaning you can pretty much go at it alone and survive quite easily, which is quite boring if you play a Co-op FPS game.

So conclusion: BUY BUY BUY, PLAY PLAY PLAY, HAVE FUN FUN FUN!!! :D

reviewText:
The most fun online multiplayer/coop FPS game I have ever played, it just never gets old or boring!

The zombie apocalypse atmosphere is really well made and realistic and the special zombies add more tension to it. Graphics and soundtrack are great and fitting as well and the whole weapon system (1 big + 1 small or melee one can be carried, plus bombs, whereas the variety is not huge, but big enough) and ability to share medkits amongst the team add more realism to it.
Many gaming modes are included too, aside from the standard campaign one, making the game a complete immersive experience.

Teamwork is everything in this game if you want to survive, so it is also a good chance to meet new people!

reviewText:
Since I've been playing this game for a bit over a year, if not more. I think I can make a little review on it.
Left 4 Dead 2 is the sequel to Left 4 Dead, no ♥♥♥♥.
It's co-op, there the more actual players than AI, the better.
The modding community is still up, well and at it after all these years.
Even though there are new survivors in the sequel, you can still play the classic maps, which is perfect, if you only have Left 4 Dead 2, and don't want to spend money on the first one.
The cons are that the players in PvP are really toxic. People yelling at you for not pouncing someone from the other side of the map, etc.
As much as I love this game, playing with bots could be fun if there were not always behind you, not moving forward if you got lost.
All in all, I have loved this game since I heard of it, and since I started playing it myself. If you like slaughtering some zombies with 3 of your friends, and fighting very stronger Tanks every now and then. My boy/girl, this game is for you.

reviewText: Unlike most other shooters, Left 4 Dead hinges on cooperative multiplayer. You and three friends must shoot, tear and slash through an unrelenting mass of raging zombies. From the moment you leave the safe house to the final rescue chopper, you are completely dependent on each other and constantly hunted by special boss zombies that behave with their own aggressive, strategizing intelligence. Thanks to Valve’s omniscient “AI Director,” the zombies spawn differently every time, the special infected try alternative attacks, and even weapon drops are changed based on your performance. This makes every single playthrough slightly different, and the resultant strategy to survive much more organic and integral than any other FPS on the market. Just like Street Fighter is much more than mashing on buttons, Left 4 Dead is far more than mindless shooting. Played properly, L4D offers 100+ hours of unrivaled co-op insanity.

reviewText:
What made Valve think something was wrong with the first Left 4 Dead to make them release this vastly inferior sequel is beyond me.

Gone is the fun of blasting through a moderately challenging campaign with friends in favour of annoying enemies that pin you down and an adaptive difficulty level that just throws cheap attacks at the worst of times.

Also, mouse lag is incredibly bad in this game, and only this one from my experience.

reviewText:
To start off, I must admit I'm a big fan of the Valve studio, simply because they will release titles that just can't seem to dissapoint.

Counterstrike, Portal, Team Fortress, Half life and so on are examples of titles that just bring pleasure, and any lacks they have will be forfeit due to the low prices they offer for their titles.

Left 4 Dead is no exception. They combined the lust of the player to shoot as many walking (un)dead people as they can with the ammunition they can find with simple, but nice gameplay. One of it's strong elements is the familiarity of this gameplay. I found a couple of Zombie Survival games quite complicated, which will be frustrating during the game instead of helpfull and fun to pick up.

The multiplayer functions are quite the same as singleplayer (though you'll find teammates definately less helpfull when playing online), with a couple of different gamemodes (only storyline is available for offline).

They also knew how to combine teamplay into this. If the other people from your team do not live up to what's expected in that difficulty, you WILL not succeed. Please note that I'm not saying this game is therefore a realistic one, it's still shooting hordes of zombies. But a little surfival is always nice next to the ''spray an burn'' of an average zombie shooter.

Anyway, Left 4 Dead 2 is a great multiplayer game and definately lives up to it's predecessor Left 4 Dead. I give it a 9/10!

reviewText: Short Review: This game is a highly overrated and generic zombie game that, in my eyes, is one of Valve's only failures. Not only does the game itself suck, the community is also quite awful. Go spend your money on some indie games or something.\n\nLong Review: Left 4 Dead 2. Although the critics and players rave about this game being one of the best zombie games on the market, it really isn't. Sure, there's lots of different areas to fight through, but they are all just retextured copies of the others. Get weapons, kill zombies, press E, kill zombies, get different weapons, kill zombies, kill more zombies, press E. That is how most of the levels work. There are also the levels where you collect x, bring to y, and hold E. Get weapons, kill zombies, pick up object, run past zombies, hold E. Rinse and repeat until you've beaten the level. Now that we've discussed the single player problems, let's move on to the multiplayer. The community sucks and expects you to know what each weapon is, what it does, and how to use it effectively as well as knowing each level like the back of your hand. You will be kicked if you don't have either 100 hours of play time or are quite skilled in everything I just listed. The game modes where you can play as the infected aren't fun either. The infected are difficult to use and are at a disadvantage when compared to the survivors. The only good thing about this game is the great integration of the Steam Workshop. You can download different music, new weapons textures, new levels, and more. In other words, buy this game if you want to be disappointed. Rating: 4.5/10

reviewText: Left 4 Dead 2 is the return to the zombie infested streets but is it a game you will want to slash through ? Im just gonna go out loud and say it if by the time youre reading this review and havent played or own L4D2 you need to get this game right now. Left 4 dead 2 is a simple game where four Charecters Coach, Ellis, Nick and Rochelle are trying to survive the zombie apocalypse. The game is tons of fun and will almost never get boring and plus as a bonus to already 5 great campaings it also adds all the campaings from the first L4D and remasters them and plus all the dlc campaings for aboslutly free. Now like with every game it has small issues that ruin the game. The shooting mechanics arent always the best and the hit detection works when it wants to. The melee weapons are a fun way of disposing of Zombies but when it comes to melee weapons its best to choose a sharp weapon instead of a blunt one. Overall the game is awesome and you just need to own this tile with some small issues its a great time and even better with friends i give Left 4 Dead 2  9.5/10

reviewText:
One of the best co-op games I have ever played. Some people say that this game is linear (what games don't have linearity?). While it is true, the extensive modding community add so many unique characters, maps, weapons, and tactical situations that the linearity completely disappears, leaving behind a hectic battle for survival.

You have multiple modes of gameplay. You can either fend for yourself in single player with bot helpers, go through a map with friends in campaign, or fight as infected in Versus and Scavenge. The difficulty modes add a lot of variety, as well. Expert requires the FPS skills of a Call Of Duty or Counter-Strike veteran and the teamwork of life-long friends.

It's never tiring to go through any map, because there's so many ways to go through it and so many different situations. The events that happen because of it creates a lot of laughs and a lot of inspiring frustration.

It can only get better from here as Valve releases sequels.

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game. Say what you will about the way Valve treated the L4D community by delivering a sequel so quickly, but there's no denying that L4D2 is a better, more polished game than the first.

This version adds new weapons, new healing options, and new special infected zombies that weren't present in the first. It doesn't really change gameplay much, but it does add a bit of variety that the original lacked. The maps are solid, and the weather effects are great, particularly in the Hard Rain level. The melee weapons that the first game painfully lacked are finally present here.

There is an active map-building community, and Valve continues to offer official maps and gameplay support. This gives the game a fair amount of replay value. But most of the replay value comes from the Versus mode. A game of L4D2 Versus is a great experience that never gets tired.

reviewText:
I was introduced into the L4D universe in the first one, I never really got to play it but some time later L4D2 came out and I bought after remembering the fun my friends had playing the first one. All from each other’s houses and that seemed fun.

So first thing about the game I’d like to talk about is the survivors. I understand leaving the first cast behind must have been somewhat though in the begging, however they first cast made it back in the awesome free DLC that completely defeated the purpose of having bought the first game.
Personality wise, the new guys were kind of a letdown, Coach and Nick were alright for me, they could bring seriousness and humor into the game at the same time, Rochelle however was just as bland as a concrete slab and Ellis was just there to be the group clown with the ever-comical southern accent. I think they were alright and somehow ran away from the typical zombie survivor template but the first group felt like the formula and they should have left it that way.
Next step brings us to the special infected. Having more of them instead of replacements was just right, the combos they could make both as bots or in competitive were nice, such as having a Spitter burning you up whenever you got pinned by one of the other infected, Jockeys dragging you away from the group when you are barely in the safe room, Chargers making the whole group fly into walls... It was nice to have to be more mindful about other threats. I’d also like to mention the “uncommon” infected from each chapter, they were like the chocolate chips on a normal horde cookie; they stood out, had a different function but were not as imposing as a special infected.
To keep this review from being too long I’ll stand by the items and weapons. Most notably we have the new melee weapons. Many people leave those behind because they can shove with the normal weapons and gameplay wise some people considered them useless or unbalanced. I simply loved them, some were funny or simply badass but nothing beats mowing down a horde when close to death under adrenaline with a guitar while the rest of the group is back you up with guns from behind. Parts fly off, heads get smashed in and you get covered in the blood of your enemies. Melee is satisfying when used right... or with a chainsaw.
The new guns were also cool, the magnum simply made a neat line of infected explode with a shot, the SCAR-H’s permanent burst fire was also something nice to have when you wanted more accurate shots without having to worry about the trigger, then that huge machine gun that came in the DLC was simply delicious to use, very limited ammo and no reloads, you just wait for a horde to unload it and scream the inner Rambo in you and lastly the grenade launcher that you should simply leave if you are not good with it or you are willing to sacrifice everyone’s health for some copious amounts of intestines flying off.
Some more important new features were the defib packs that came to steal the importance of first-aid kits, the adrenaline shots that were perfect for that tight moment, the boomer bile to throw in a fire or at a tank, so much fun and lastly the weapon mods like laser sights and incendiary/explosive ammo, more tools to cause mayhem and survive in style.
Overall, it’s a nice game to sink an afternoon in with friends, if you don’t have friends to play you can join random games but it’s not as fun. A mic is highly recommended to have higher survival chances. In case you get bored from running from zombies, there are game modes that allow to play as one or to hold your ground against waves of infected meat. There’s also the dreaded realism mode that removes all visual and audio hints and forces you group to be tight and communicate everything and on last word I’d like to talk about the maps, it’s the southern ‘merica experience and a refreshing area to play in, all the way to New Orleans.
TL;DR: I am Rodrigosth and I recommend this game to you and your friends to play together.
Special thanks to Hirow to help me keep my facts straight.

reviewText:
Great game that encourages teamwork and using a little strategy and patience to survive.

I think my favorite part though is the mods you can get for the game, can easily turn this game from spooky to downright hilarious.

Tank scaring you? Turn it into Shrek!
Smoker annoying or creepy? Turn it into the Dusk from Kingdom Hearts and give it the Yoshi soundfont.
Hunter's pounce annoy you? Give it the Sonic soundfont, at least makes it somewhat funny.
Boomers? Turn them into Dr. Robotnik (yes, there is a mod like that, look it up)

Don't like the music? Find new music from the workshop you like.

This game + Workshop = Hilarity and much more funner game playing. :D

reviewText: Very Very Very similar to the first game. Almost nothing different. I was very dis- appoint in this game, at first! All the different gamemodes made up for a lot. The game has a lot of gore (like the first one, again) but is still very fun to play with ever gamemode. Two problems I have with this game is that I go to play campain, but it doesn't leave off where i was, it starts me with random people on a completly different mission, I don't know if this is just me. All in all I really enjoyed this game!! 8/10 :D

reviewText:
Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best games I have ever played. It just never gets old! The gameplay is really awesome, and shooting the hell out of zombies with your friends is always a good time!

This brings me to my next point. This game is a hundred times better when played with friends. I played this almost every night for a year or two on the Xbox 360 and met 2 of my really good friends on there. It's even more fun to play on Steam because you can use mods to make the game cooler and funnier, and even add new campaigns.

I strongly suggest getting this game.

reviewText:
Forget Valve's campaigns—you haven't played L4D2 until you've defended the gates of Helm's Deep from thousands of zombies. L4D2's quietly prolific community has been cranking out incredible campaigns over the past year.

Go to www.l4dmaps.com, and try these:

-Helm's Deep Reborn
-Questionable Ethics
-Detour Ahead

Installation couldn't be easier: just download the file, open it, double-click the .VPK and it'll auto-install.
